questions.clue: In 'Forrest Gump,' this titular character says his momma always makes this comfort food the best.
In 'Ratatouille,' the critic Anton Ego has his heart won over by this traditional French vegetable dish.
In 'The Godfather,' this Italian dish is used as a metaphor during a family meeting to 'leave the gun, take the...' part.
In 'Julie & Julia,' this French recipe is Julie's first attempt from Julia Child's cookbook.
In 'Pulp Fiction,' Vincent explains that in France, a Quarter Pounder is called this because of the metric system.
Launched in 2004, this social media platform significantly changed how people interact online.
First released in 2007, this Apple product revolutionized smartphones with its multi-touch interface.
This online video platform was purchased by Google in 2006 and has become a major site for content creators.
Developed by SpaceX, this rocket series became the first to carry astronauts to the ISS on a commercially built spacecraft.
This AI language model developed by OpenAI, released in 2020, is capable of generating human-like text based on input.

categories.name: Ancient Civilizations: Beyond Egypt and Greece

questions.clue: This ancient civilization, known for its ziggurat structures, developed the first known form of writing called cuneiform.
The Indus Valley Civilization, one of the world's earliest urban cultures, was located in present-day Pakistan and northwest India.
This Mesoamerican civilization is known for its calendar system and the colossal stone heads it left behind.
Renowned for their bronze work and oracle bones, this dynasty is the first historically confirmed Chinese dynasty.
Located in the Andes, this civilization built the city of Tiwanaku near Lake Titicaca and significantly influenced the Inca.

categories.name: Literary Maps: Places that Don’t Exist

questions.clue: This Shire is a peaceful region of Middle-earth, home to Hobbits and created by J.R.R. Tolkien.
Developed by Lewis Carroll, this world takes you through a rabbit hole to encounter the Queen of Hearts.
C.S. Lewis created this land of talking animals and White Witches, accessed through a wardrobe.
It's the capital of Oceania in George Orwell's dystopian novel, known for its ever-watchful Big Brother.
In Lyman Frank Baum's classic, this city rules over a magical land and is noted for its distinctive emerald color.

categories.name: Cryptic Elements: The Periodic Table’s Mysteries

questions.clue: This element traditionally gave the name to a certain type of age and is symbolized by the letter 'F'.
Used in batteries, this soft, silvery metal is represented by the symbol 'Li'.
This element's symbol 'Au' originated from the Latin word 'aurum'.
Named after Stockholm, this element has the atomic number 62 and is a rare earth metal.
This radioactive element was named after the homeland of Marie Curie and has the symbol 'Po'.

final.clue: This novel, published in 1932 and set in a dystopian future, introduced the phrase 'World State' and is known for its critique of a technologically advanced society.
